title: Queen and Prince Philip mark 73rd wedding anniversary with new photo
description: The royals are pictured looking at a homemade card from their great-grandchildren.

title: Obama memoir: What he really thought of Putin and other leaders
description: The former US president's record-selling memoir contains some candid portraits of world leaders.

title: Tiger Woods to line up with 11-year-old son Charlie in Orlando event
description: Tiger Woods will be joined by 11-year-old son Charlie in the PNC Championship team event at the Ritz-Carlton Golf Club in Orlando from 17-20 December.

title: Weekly quiz: How did Rupert Grint set Instagram record?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Coronavirus: Christmas socialising poses 'substantial risks' - scientist
description: Proposals to ease restrictions over Christmas will be set out next week, a No 10 spokesman said.

title: Guardiola signs new two-year contract with Man City
description: Pep Guardiola signs a new two-year deal that will see him remain as Manchester City manager until the summer of 2023.

title: Defence funding boost 'extends British influence'
description: Boris Johnson says "the safety of the British people must come first" as he outlines a new package.

title: Covid-hit sports to receive £300m emergency funding from government
description: The government announces a rescue package of £300m of emergency funding for sports impacted by the absence of spectators because of coronavirus.

title: Climate change: Can sending fewer emails really save the planet?
description: UK officials are reportedly considering asking us to stop sending "thanks" emails - but why?

title: Birmingham pub bombings: Man questioned over blasts
description: A 65-year-old man arrested over the blasts is reported to be Michael Patrick Reilly.

title: Fairytale of New York: BBC Radio 1 will not play original version
description: The station says its young listeners may be offended by some of the Christmas classic's lyrics.

title: Ford on bench as Curry & Underhill start for England against Ireland
description: George Ford will start on the bench as he returns from injury for England's Autumn Nations Cup match against Ireland, with captain Owen Farrell starting at fly-half.

title: Pompeo in unprecedented West Bank settlement visit
description: It is the first time a top US official has made such a trip, widely seen as controversial.

title: Clubs could face transfer ban if they shirk new Fifa rules on maternity leave
description: New Fifa regulations around maternity cover are hailed as an 'essential step' and clubs face transfer bans for not following them.

title: Covid: Oxford vaccine shows 'encouraging' immune response in older adults
description: The phase two trial results raise hopes the jab can protect age groups most at risk from Covid-19.

title: Australian 'war crimes': Elite troops killed Afghan civilians, report finds
description: A misconduct inquiry uncovered a 'shameful record' of a 'warrior culture' among some soldiers.

title: Royal Mail parcels overtake letters for first time
description: Online shopping during the pandemic means revenues from parcels surpasses letters for the first time.

title: Dozy dormouse gets stuck in garden bird feeder on the Isle of Wight
description: The dormouse appears to have enjoyed the seed mix in the feeder a little too much.

title: The taste of loneliness? A photo of fish and chips
description: Five very different ways of living with loneliness.

title: ComparetheMarket fined £17.9m over competition law breach
description: Contracts meant getting the best home insurance deals was not as "simples" as its adverts suggest.

title: Is Atletico Madrid's Felix finally justifying £113m fee?
description: How an ageing Luis Suarez and a coming-of-age Joao Felix are leading an Atletico Madrid title challenge which could last the course.

title: Covid in Scotland: How do Scots rate their leaders in the pandemic?
description: A survey for BBC Scotland suggests people are not wholly uncritical, but back the Scottish government's approach.

title: The Papers: Christmas 'is back on' and defence 'spending spree'
description: The papers focus on plans to relax Covid rules over Christmas and a £16.5bn boost for the military.

title: Thailand protesters drench police headquarters with paint
description: The police headquarters in Bangkok was defaced a day after violent clashes left dozens injured.

title: Intubated Covid patient plays violin to thank Utah hospital staff
description: This music teacher shows his appreciation, while intubated, for those who cared for him.

title: In pictures: Turning the iconic Ghana Must Go bag into high fashion
description: A simple bag with a painful history for many Ghanaians is the subject of a photography series.

title: Keith Richards: 'I'll celebrate the Stones' 60th anniversary in a wheelchair'
description: Keith Richards on the US election, being punched by Chuck Berry and the Rolling Stones' future.

title: Was the scientific advice for lockdown flawed?
description: A BBC documentary highlights weaknesses in the expert analysis of the likely impact of coronavirus.

title: EU faces challenge from three states to Covid budget
description: EU leaders will meet via video, with Hungary and Poland objecting to funds being tied to rule of law.

title: Have female CEOs coped better with Covid than men?
description: Have female bosses coped with the pandemic better than their male counterparts?

title: Apprentice redundancy numbers rise: 'I was devastated'
description: Two-thirds more apprenticeships ended in redundancy as Covid hit employers, BBC figures show.

title: Coronavirus: 'We need to know if we can reopen after lockdown’
description: Struggling businesses say they want more clarity about what happens when lockdown ends.

title: Pike River: The 29 coal miners who never came home
description: It's been 10 years since New Zealand's Pike River mine disaster, and families of victims still feel raw.

title: Loneliness 'feels like being in a grave'
description: Sophie from Huddersfield sought help to overcome loneliness.

title: US election 2020: How much did it cost and who paid for it?
description: The US elections in 2020 cost a record $14bn. BBC Reality Check takes a look at who paid this and how it was spent

title: COP26: Frustrated by delay, young activists stage virtual Mock COP
description: Young climate activists call for urgent action at Mock COP as Covid delays UN climate talks.

title: Private baby scans show 'incredibly poor practice'
description: BBC News uncovers evidence that women have not been told about serious abnormalities and conditions.
